content:
The chunk describes various parameters related to object appearance and positioning in a graphical user interface (GUI) context within the Panda3D framework. These include properties such as image textures, geometry transformations, parent nodes, position, orientation, scale, and padding for GUI elements like buttons, sliders, and other interactive components.

Context: This section details configuration options for styling and positioning GUI objects in Panda3D's PGFrameStyle system.

the bevel (Width,Height) image An image to be displayed on the object image filename or Texture object image_pos Position of the displayed image (x,y,z) image_hpr Rotation of the displayed image (h,p,r) image_scale Scale of the displayed image (sx,sy,sz) geom A geom to represent the object’s appearance NodePath geom_pos Position of the displayed geom (x,y,z) geom_hpr Rotation of the displayed geom (h,p,r) geom_scale Scale of the displayed geom (sx,sy,sz) parent Parent to attach to NodePath pos Position of the object (X,Y,Z) hpr Orientation of the object (H,P,R) scale Scale of the object Number pad When frameSize is omitted, this determines the extra space around
